thread.title: Saint Paul Police announce arrest in Mac-Groveland sexual assault and robbery
thread.title_full: Saint Paul Police announce arrest in Mac-Groveland sexual assault and robbery

author: Naasir Akailvi
title: Saint Paul Police announce arrest in Mac-Groveland sexual assault and robbery
text:
ST PAUL, Minn â€” Editor's Note: The above video first aired on April 16.
The Saint Paul Police Department has arrested a suspect in the case of a woman who was sexually assaulted and robbed in her Mac-Groveland home on April 16.
The man was arrested after law enforcement agencies executed search warrants in Stillwater and Maplewood on Thursday morning, according to a SPPD spokesperson.
He was then booked into the Ramsey County Jail on suspicion of criminal sexual misconduct, first-degree burglary and kidnapping, according to the SPPD.
According to St. Paul police, officers were
[called to a home](/article/news/local/woman-sexually-assaulted-st-paul-burglary-mac-groveland/89-ffee598d-516d-46e9-a2b1-bfc214afe857) in the 300 block of Snelling Avenue South just after 4:30 a.m. on April 16 for a report of a sexual assault.
Officers spoke to the adult victim when they arrived in the area. She said she was sleeping when she heard someone pounding on her home's side door.
Then an unknown man tried to force his way into her home.
Police said the suspect stole money from the woman before pulling out a weapon and sexually assaulting her.
The suspect fled the home and the woman called 911, police said. Fire medics took the woman to Regions Hospital to be evaluated.
Officers secured the area and searched the neighborhood for the suspect, but were unable to find him at that time.
This is a developing story and will be updated as more information becomes available.
